thread.title: Zlatan Ibrahimovic boasts he is the Indiana Jones of football after plundering hat-trick
thread.title_full: Zlatan Ibrahimovic boasts he is the Indiana Jones of football after plundering hat-trick

author: ashilton
title: Zlatan Ibrahimovic boasts he is the Indiana Jones of football after plundering hat-trick
text:
TEMPLE OF BOOM Zlatan Ibrahimovic boasts he is the Indiana Jones of football after plundering hat-trick 
Man Utd hitman has bagged 31 trophies in career and is eyeing more silverware after Saint-Etienne win in Europa League By ALEC SHILTON Comments ZLATAN IBRAHIMOVIC has boasted he is football’s Indiana Jones. 
The Swedish hitman plundered another three goals last night as his 23-goal Manchester United adventure continues to be box-office viewing. 5 How Zlatan Ibrahimovic could look as Indiana Jones 
Having already won the Community Shield, Zlatan is confident that he can scoop more silverware this season – with another THREE trophies in sight. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Manchester United news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
With United set to reach the last-16 of the Europa League after taking a commanding three-goal first-leg lead over St-Etienne , Zlatan has the EFL Cup final against Southampton next Sunday as he goes in quest of the 32nd trophy of his career. 
And the FA Cup is still up for grabs too, with a fifth-round trip to Blackburn in front of Jose Mourinho’s men this Sunday. PA:Press Association Ibrahimovic netted the 17th hat-trick of his career in the St Etienne win PA:Press Association Ibra completes his hat-trick with a late penalty at Old Trafford Manchester United fans sing a hilarious Zlatan Ibrahimovic song 
Zlatan said: "Every trophy for me is incredible, everywhere I came I won so if I can win something here I will be super happy. 
"People that know me know that I play in many clubs and I try to do my best. 
"Wherever I went I won, so I am like Indiana Jones." 
Last night's trio of strikes was the 17th of his career and took his goal tally against St Etienne alone to 17. Sutton's plastic pitch should suit Arsene Wenger's side down to the ground 'Wasted on me' Burton's Jackson Irvine snubbed £100k-a-week pay-rise in China... to stay with Championship strugglers RON THE BOX Cristiano Ronaldo and Angelina Jolie set to star in Turkish TV series about Syrian refugees DANNY HIGGINBOTHAM The FA Cup fifth-round draw is a belter... and Arsenal and Co. could find themselves on the end even more shocks Sol mate Arsenal could make last-ditch attempt to hijack Dominic Solanke's move to Liverpool 
Zlatan added: "It feels good. I got a lot of help from my team-mates. 
"We played an open game and it was important to get a good result so we can take it into the second leg. 
"We won 3-0 and I got to score the three goals so I am happy for that. We have still many games to play so hopefully I can continue like I am doing. 
"I've scored a couple of goals against them, I don't focus on specific opponents, I just try to do my job, try to do what I am good at. Getty Images Ibrahimovic walks off with the match ball after putting St Etienne to the sword Getty Images Ander Herrera celebrates after Ibrahimovic opened the scoring Manchester United star Zlatan Ibrahimovic is still top of his game due to hard training 
"It's a good result because I know how difficult it is to play over there. 
"They have a fantastic crowd, fantastic support, and the stadium is very nice, so the guys will see it when we go there. It was important today to get a good result. 
"It is a good team. They always make it difficult for every team they play against and when I was at PSG the same thing. They did good. 
"I think a couple of players are new, a couple of players left, but it is a good team." Zlatan Ibrahimovic scores a landmark goal for Manchester United
